tn.text: AT: "in the eleventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: on the first day of the month
tn.text: It is uncertain which month of the Hebrew calendar Ezekiel meant. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
AT: "the people of Tyre have said against the people of Jerusalem." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "Yes!" or "Very good!"

tn.ref: The gates of the people are broken
tn.text: The people of Tyre use these words to refer to Jerusalem as if it were a city gate through which traders from the surrounding nations pass. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Armies have broken down the gates of the people" or "Armies have destroyed Jerusalem, which was like gates through which people from many nations passed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here the word "she" refers to the word "gates" which have "turned" on their hinges to open to Tyre. This phrase means that Tyre has now replaced Jerusalem as the city through which the traders from many nations pass. AT: "The gateway has opened to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here to "be filled up" means to be prosperous. AT: "I will be prosperous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"Jerusalem is ruined"
AT: "Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"

tn.ref: I will raise up many nations against you like the sea raises its waves
tn.text: Here the word "nations" refers to their armies. AT: "I will gather an army from the nations that is as great and powerful as the waves in the raging sea." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
A tower is a tall building used to watch for enemies or to hide in.

tn.ref: I will sweep her dust away and make her like a bare rock
tn.text: AT: "I will cause the army to completely destroy the city, and they will leave nothing there so that it will be like a rock with nothing on it."
Cities are often referred to as "she." AT: "Tyre will become" or "It will become."

tn.ref: a place for nets to dry out in the midst of the sea
tn.text: Part of Tyre was an island. AT: "an empty island used for drying fishing nets" or "a deserted island where people dry out their fishing nets"

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].
things that people have stolen

tn.ref: she will become plunder for the nations
tn.text: AT: "armies from the nations will steal everything from Tyre." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Her daughters who are in the fields will be slaughtered by the swords
tn.text: AT: "The enemy armies will kill her daughters who are in the fields." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Her daughters who are in the fields
tn.text: Villages were sometimes called the daughters of the cities that ruled over them. Possible meanings are 1) the small villages on that mainland that Tyre ruled over, or 2) the young women of Tyre who were working in the fields.

tn.ref: they will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated the similar phrase "you will know that I am Yahweh" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
AT: "Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"
God is using Nebuchadnezzar to bring about his will.
"most powerful king"
This exclamation emphasizes the great size of Nebuchadnezzar's army.
Here the word "He" refers to Nebuchadnezzar and is a metonym for is army. AT: "His army will kill your daughters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Tyre.
The word "he" refers to Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:01|4:2]].
"his instruments of war"
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Tyre.

tn.ref: Will not the islands quake ... in your midst
tn.text: "The islands quake ... in your midst." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Tyre.
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Tyre.

The word "you" refers to the city of Tyre. In the original language it is feminine singular, because nations were often thought of as a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
